section.title: Export Notification
section.para: This module enables a bank user acting on behalf of the Advising Bank, in a Letter of Credit transaction, to create new Export Letter of Credit notifications to the bank's customers (the beneficiaries of the LC). After receiving notification of an Import letter of credit from a third party, a bank user can create an Export Letter of credit, to notify their relevant client of the transaction. Export Notification

section.title: Export Notification - Navigation
section.para:
After selecting the Trade Middle Office option from the Administrator's list on the home page, the Export Notification function can be selected from the left side navigation menu. Export Notification
Navigation

section.title: Export Notification Options
section.para: When the Export Notification function is selected from the side navigation menu of the Trade Administration module, a number of options are listed.

The available options are: Options
Export Notification
Export Notification
Options
Standard
Create a standard Export Letter of Credit to be created by the bank.
Free Format
Create an Export Letter of Credit Notification in free format.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit Export Letter of Credit that you or another user have already created from an existing record and saved.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit an Export Letter of Credit that you or another user have created but has not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Export Notification - Free Format
section.para:
This option is used to create an Export Letter of Credit Notification in free format. Since the terms of an Export Letter of Credit received from the Issuing Bank are often expressed as a free text, or in the form of a unstructured letter, the Free Format option is provided to enable a bank user acting on behalf of the Advising Bank, to notify such free format instructions to the customers. section.title: Export Notification - Edit Transactions
section.para:
This option is used to complete an Export Letter of Credit notification that a user has already started and saved, to be completed at a later stage. When this option is selected, a list is displayed of Export Letter of Credit notifications that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter. The columns show in the list are the , Company, Ccy, Amount, User Name (of the person who originally created the message), Release Date and Status of each message.
Click on the column of the required entry to open it for further editing.

section.title: Export Notification - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para:
This option is used by an authorised bank user, to submit an Export Letter of Credit notification that a bank user has already started but been unable to submit due to insufficient authority. Retrieve Unsigned
Export Notification
Export Notification
Retrieve Unsigned
Retrieve
Unsigned Export Notification

When this option is selected, a list is displayed of Export Letter of Credit Notifications that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. If sufficient authorisations are allocated in the profile of the authorising user, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which must be ticked to select it. A Submit button at the end of the page, submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is re-displayed.
